N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 3.39 - State aid calculations

State Regulations

Except where otherwise specifically provided for by statute
or in other provisions of this Title, calculations made in the determination
and payment of State aid for school districts, boards of cooperative
educational services, or any other entity entitled to receive an apportionment
pursuant to the Education Law, or any other law shall be made as
follows: (a) payments of State aid, whether partial or in full, shall be rounded up to the next whole
dollar; (b) totals and category
subtotals of expenditures, tax levies, valuations, and revenues (including

State aid) shall be rounded up to the next whole dollar; and
(c) pupil count components and subtotals
shall be expressed to two decimal places without rounding, except that resident
weighted average daily attendance, total wealth pupil units, and total aidable
pupil units for operating aid shall be rounded up to the next whole
number. Notes
